page.title: 05The River Glen.
page.content: The well-known fresh-water fish (roach,dace,chub,bream,perch,tench and pike) abound in the Glen. Anglers come from all over to tempt them. The sluice marks the saltwater limit of the Glen. At the "Reservoir" there are fishing boats,sailing boats and cruisers. The creek is tidal and can be used 1 hour before high water and 3 hours afterwards. Most boats go for day trips into the Wash to collect cockles,shrimps and samphor. The creek is almost the same now as it was three hundred year ago,apart from a new sluice up stream. The old one was outside the "Ship Inn". Two freshwater rivers empty into the tidal Welland, the Glen and the Vernats. Ducks and swans breed on the Glen and some feed at back doors of kindly folk living nearby. M. Jackson.
